msDesc.head: Henricus de Frimaria, De perfectione interioris hominis; Germany, 14th century, middle or second half

msItem.author: Henricus de Frimaria
msItem.title: De perfectione interioris hominis
msItem.incipit: Qui non causidici. Et est inuocatio et continencia libri presentis cuius titulus est liber de perfeccione spirituali interioris hominis. Istum librum pro honore dei et edificacione legencium studiose concepit magister Henricus de Vrimaria
(fol. 2r) Quia multa predicabilia pulcra et vtilia licet sparsim et diffuse in libris collacionum
Quia meriti rationali virtutes non possunt inseri nisi prius uicia exterpuntur
msItem.explicit: gloriam eterne beatitudinis recepturi. Qui est honor et gloria in secula seculorum amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de perfeccione interioris hominis studiose conceptus per magistrum Henricum de Vrimaria sacre theologie professore ex libris collacionum et institucionum sacrum patrum

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.rubric: Oratio magistri henrici thoctzen cum legere uoluit

msItem.note: The distich 'Littera gesta docet' with note on the four levels of interpretation.

note.q: Ne confundaris . taceas . fugias et patiaris. Hoc Bernardus.

msItem.note: Fol. 64b, an inserted slip, is from a table of contents for another book from St Peter's Erfurt.

supportDesc.support: paper, folded in octavo. Watermarks: two circles with cross (WZIS), pear with two leaves (type Piccard ii.508–730)
supportDesc.collation: 1–15(8) (fols. 1–120), 16(8+1) (one leaf added at the end of the quire) (fols. 121–9)

layoutDesc.layout: 1 col., c. 31–3 lines. Partly frame-ruled, partly unruled; written space 160–70 100–5

handDesc.handNote: One scribe, textualis with cursive features.

decoDesc.decoNote: Five-line red initial with simple penwork decoration in red, fol. 1r.
Elsewhere mostly three-line initials in red or the ink of the text, or both, sometimes with simple silhouette decoration.

binding.p: 15th-century binding of brown leather over boards, stamped and ruled in blind; clasp, mostly lost; four (of five) bosses on the lower board (none on the upper board); contemporary contents label and pressmark (D XXXIIII). Bindery of St Peter's Erfurt, Einbanddatenbank 501181s: stamps s015807, s015809, s015813, s015822 and possibly others. Tabs.

physDesc.accMat: Traces of offset from a missing pastedown on the lower inside board.

history.provenance: Benedictine abbey of St Peter, Erfurt: ex libris, fol. 1r, 15th century, with pressmark D 34; ex libris, 18th century, fol. 1r.
Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831 (?): possibly identifiable as 469 in the catalogue of part 3 of his sale, 10 Oct. 1836.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (Oct. 2020). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 36
